Package pr1.helper.extension

Class PrintDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • pr1.helper.extension.PrintDecorator
  • public class PrintDecorator
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class to decorate text output with borders and headlines.

    The PrintDecorator allows adding simple framed borders around text and creating visually distinct headlines in console or file output.

    This class is typically used with PrintWriter to enhance console or file output formatting.

    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Wagner
    See Also:
    PrintWriter

    • Field Detail

      • frameChar

        public char frameChar
        Character used to draw the frame. Default is '#'

      • out

        public java.io.PrintWriter out
        The PrintWriter used for output

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrintDecorator

        public PrintDecorator​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Constructs a PrintDecorator using the given PrintWriter. The default frame character '#' is used.
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter for output

      • PrintDecorator

        public PrintDecorator​(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                      char frameChar)
        Constructs a PrintDecorator using the given PrintWriter and frame character.
        Parameters:
        out - the PrintWriter for output
        frameChar - the character used for framing

    • Method Detail

      • printBorder

        public void printBorder​(java.lang.String text)
        Prints a border around the given text with default bottom margin of 1 line.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to determine the border width

      • printBorder

        public void printBorder​(java.lang.String text,
                        int marginBottom)
        Prints a border around the given text with a specified bottom margin.

        The width of the border matches the length of the input text plus padding.

        Parameters:
        text - the text to determine the border width
        marginBottom - the number of line breaks to add after the border

      • printHeadline

        public void printHeadline​(java.lang.String text)
        Prints a headline framed by borders above and below the text.

        The headline consists of a top border, the text framed by the frameChar, and a bottom border with a default bottom margin of 2 lines.

        Parameters:
        text - the headline text
